disease: Squamous cell carcinoma of skin of left lower limb, including hip

symptoms.name: Non-healing sore or scab
symptoms.pattern: Persistent for about two months or longer

symptoms.name: Hard, ulcerative mass
symptoms.pattern: Irregular border, yellowish slough in base, blood oozing (case report)

physical_findings: Hard ulcerative mass of 5x4 cm in the right inguinal region along the crease with an irregular border, yellowish slough in the base, and blood oozing (case report)
Multiple hard enlargements of inguinal lymph nodes (case report)
Intact sensation and distal pulsation (case report)
risk_factors: Blond or red hair, light-colored eyes, freckles, easy sunburn

imaging_findings.PET/CT: Diffuse metastasis, right inguinal mass (SUV max 9.6), diffuse bone metastasis in left proximal femur (SUV max 11.5), bilateral iliac, sacrum, vertebral bodies, right scapula, right upper ribs, and right anterior pulmonary nodule (SUV max 4.7) (case report)

required: Histopathological confirmation of squamous cell carcinoma
supportive: Clinical presentation consistent with SCC (e.g., non-healing sore, scaly patch)
Positive imaging findings suggestive of metastasis
